div.pre: 1943 Campiglia Marittima, 14 km. N of (194) Piombino, Etruria, 1932 Burial: 4th cent. B.C. ? (K) Contents: 18+ AV, AR? Etruscan: 5+ 50-unit pieces 8+ 25-unit pieces 2+ 12 1/2-unit pieces 3+ 10-unit pieces ANS 1967.152.5 ANS 1967.152.6 ANS 1967.152.7 Disposition: New York 3 (SNG 1-3); de Nanteuil 3 (as the New York pieces); Lloyd 8 (SNG 9-14, 17-18); Naville July 3, 1933, 4-8 (5 = Lloyd 10) A 1936 letter from Ravel in the ANS states that at the time the gold appeared on the market, there also appeared a "pretty large quan- tity" of Populonian silver, which Ravel believed was found with the gold. The silver included examples of Sambon 28, 35, 41a, 47, 50, 52, 56, 60a, 73, and probably others
